courseStructure.title: Course Structure
courseStructure.description: This intensive course runs from February to July (6 months) and takes you from A0 to A2. It includes 15 hours of classes per week, held four times a week. Each day consists of 3 periods, with each period lasting 1 hour 20 minutes.

thevarasa.name: Thevarasa Sabilshan
thevarasa.goal: Main goal: improve speaking skills to build future career
thevarasa.review:
I am currently studying Russian for my university studies and future career, and my experience with this course has been excellent. I have been studying here for three months, around three hours a day, and my Russian has improved significantly, especially my speaking skills.

The speaking practice is the most valuable part of the course for me. The lessons are well balanced, and the teachers are friendly, supportive, and explain everything clearly at the right pace.I feel comfortable during classes and can now communicate confidently with Russians.

The course exceeded my expectations in every way. Communication with the school is clear and efficient, the learning platform is excellent, and the classroom environment is comfortable and welcoming. Overall, this program has been a great step toward my academic and professional goals.

akil.name: Akil Vaibhav
akil.goal: Main goal: prepare for a medical residency in Russia
akil.review:
As a medical student planning to do my residency in Russia, I needed a Russian course that was practical, focused, and effective — and this course delivered. In just a few months my Russian has improved significantly, especially my speaking skills. I can now hold proper conversations, which I couldn’t do before.

I really enjoy the small class sizes, which allow for more personalized lessons and meaningful interaction with the teachers. They explain new material clearly, keep the pace engaging, and create a supportive, comfortable environment where I feel confident to participate.

The course is perfectly balanced between speaking, grammar, vocabulary, listening, and reading, and the lesson materials, platform, and homework are very helpful. The school is easy to find, the classrooms are comfortable and clean, and I feel safe and part of a supportive learning community.

This program has exceeded my expectations and has been an essential step toward my academic and professional goals in medicine.

pavan.name: Pavan Kumar Rajaguru
pavan.goal: Main goal: become comfortable living and communicating in Russia
pavan.review:
I am a working professional in the business field, and my goal was to become comfortable living and communicating in Russia. After studying for three months and dedicating more than three hours a day, I can confidently say the course exceeded my expectations.

The interactive lessons, strong focus on speaking practice, and variety of teaching styles from different teachers made learning both effective and engaging. The teachers explained new material clearly and at the right pace, and I always felt supported and comfortable during essons.

My Russian has improved significantly, especially speaking and reading. I can now form basic sentences, interact with public employees, and feel confident going out on my own using Russian. The classes have been extremely useful in daily life and at work, and the supportive learning environment made a real difference.

Overall, the course is well structured, practical, and focused on student needs. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to build real confidence using Russian in everyday life.

ramaiah.name: Ramaiah Ganesan Tamizhinya
ramaiah.goal: Main goal: use Russian confidently in university and daily life
ramaiah.review:
I am a medical student, and my main goal for learning Russian was to use it confidently in university and daily life. Even within a short period of study, the course made a noticeable difference in my ability to communicate.

The strongest part of the program was the focus on conversational skills. Speaking practice, role playing, and group discussions helped me build confidence and actively use Russian instead of just memorizing rules. The interactive lessons and opportunities to practice with native speakers made learning engaging and enjoyable.

I feel that my Russian has improved significantly, especially in speaking, vocabulary, and grammar. I am now more comfortable using grammatical cases and expressing myself in conversations. The teachers explained new material clearly, maintained a good pace, and created a supportive and comfortable learning environment.

The course created a motivating and welcoming atmosphere that made learning Russian feel natural and practical. The classes were well organized, the environment was comfortable, and the strong sense of community encouraged regular speaking and steady progress. I would highly recommend this program to anyone looking for a supportive and effective way to learn Russian.

safety.heading: Safety & Health Information
safety.subheading: Stay safe and healthy during your stay in Russia
tips: Always carry your passport and migration card.
Register your address within 7 days of arrival (we help with this).
Learn basic Russian phrases for emergencies.
Save emergency numbers: Police (102), Ambulance (103), Fire (101).
Use official taxis or ride-sharing apps (Yandex Taxi, Uber).
Moscow is generally safe, but be aware of your surroundings in crowded places.
safety.insurance: All international students must have medical insurance valid in Russia. We recommend policies starting from €20/month.
safety.facilities: Moscow has excellent private and public hospitals. We'll provide you with a list of English-speaking doctors and clinics near the school.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about studying Russian with us
faq.introText: Find answers below or contact us directly for personalized assistance.

items.q: Can I work while studying in Moscow?
items.a: International students on a student visa can work part-time (up to 20 hours per week) with proper work authorization. We can advise you on the legal requirements and help with paperwork if needed.

items.q: What is the cost of living in Moscow?
items.a: Living costs in Moscow typically range from €400–800 per month depending on your lifestyle. This usually covers accommodation, food, transport, and basic leisure.

items.q: How do I apply to the school?
items.a: Fill out the online application form, complete the free placement test, and schedule a consultation with our admissions team. We guide you through every step of enrollment.

items.q: Do I need to know Russian before applying?
items.a: No. We welcome complete beginners. Our programmes cover all levels from A1 to C2, and the placement test will determine your starting level.

items.q: How do I get a Russian student visa?
items.a: After enrollment we issue an official invitation letter required for your visa application. You then apply at the nearest Russian consulate. The process usually takes 2–4 weeks, and we support you throughout.
We offer student dormitories, host family options for cultural immersion, and assistance with finding private apartments, all within convenient distance of the school.
Yes, health insurance valid in Russia is mandatory for obtaining a student visa. We can recommend affordable policies that meet the requirements.

items.q: What happens if I miss classes?
items.a: For intensive courses, missed lessons can often be made up in another group or through additional materials. For individual lessons, we can reschedule with advance notice.

items.q: Can I extend my course or change programmes?
items.a: Yes. Many students extend their studies or switch programmes. We help you update the necessary documents and registration.

items.q: Do you offer online courses for students outside Russia?
items.a: Yes. Our online Russian courses include live Zoom lessons with our teachers and access to the same learning platform as on-site students.
